title: DOCKER: Invalid block: receipts root mismatch @v21.7.3

labels.name: P2
labels.description: High (ex: Degrading performance issues, unexpected behavior of core features (DevP2P, syncing, etc))

body:
### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. Have a running working v21.7.2 version in docker
2. Upgrade to v21.7.3

**Expected behavior:**
```besu_1           | 2021-09-05 15:52:59.458+00:00 | nioEventLoopGroup-3-10 | INFO  | FullSyncTargetManager | No sync target, waiting for peers: 1

### Versions
* Docker Version: Docker Latest (v21.7.3)
Hey @mrmariomichel, thanks for raising an issue! At a super quick glance this looks like it could be related to the ongoing network issues on ETC but I'll refer to someone else to weigh in
@vmichalik but with version 21.7.2 all works just fine, really because of the current issues caused by old versions of coregeth ?

FWIW there is no issue on the Besu side here a priori. You just connected to a peer that fed you a bad block. That can come from a few things, but it's possible you're getting that block from a core-geth node in the minority. Your client is ignoring the block and disconnecting from the node.

You may have experienced this sporadically because peer connections are random, based on discovery. So switching versions and restarting for example is not enough, you may well just be connecting to different peers.

I'm consistently getting this issue with `21.7.3` and `21.7.2`, but not `21.7.1`.

Weirdly enough my node rejects valid blocks (block hash matches public block explorers) with `receipts root mismatch`.

Example logs for besu running on `kotti` ETC testnet:

It seems block hash is on the canonical chain when you check it in a public Kotti explorer (assuming blockscout is on the canonical chain):
https://blockscout.com/etc/kotti/blocks/4805337/transactions

I don't know how the receipts roots don't match even though the block hash is correct. It smells like a regression, given it doesn't seem to happen with `21.7.1`.
Furthermore, this bug seems to cause besu to reject all valid peers in general. Logs `No sync target, waiting for peers` forever after encountering the "bad" (but actually good) block.
